core-values.name: Core Values
core-values.description: This team displays extraordinary enthusiasm and spirit, knows they can accomplish more together than they could as individuals, and shows each other and other teams respect at all times.

innovation-project.name: Innovation Project
innovation-project.description: This team utilizes diverse resources for their Innovation Project to help them gain a comprehensive understanding of their problem; has a creative, well-researched solution; and effectively communicates their findings to judges and the community.

robot-design.name: Robot Design
robot-design.description: This team uses outstanding programming principles and solid engineering practices to develop a robot that is mechanically sound, durable, efficient, and highly capable of performing challenge missions.

robot-performance.name: Robot Performance
robot-performance.description: This award celebrates a team that scores the most points during the Robot Game. Teams have a chance to compete in at least three 2.5-minute matches, and their highest score counts.

champions.name: Champion's
champions.description: This award celebrates a team that embodies the FIRST LEGO® League Challenge experience by fully embracing the Core Values while achieving excellence and innovation in Robot Performance, Robot Design, and the Innovation Project.

impact.name: Impact
impact.description: This award celebrates a team that has made a significant ongoing impact on their community. They demonstrate that they understand the importance of sharing their knowledge and inspiring others.

lead-mentor.name: Coach/Mentor
lead-mentor.description: Coaches and mentors inspire their teams to do their best, both as individuals and together. Without them, there would be no FIRST LEGO League Challenge. This award goes to the coach or mentor whose leadership and guidance is clearly evident and best exemplifies the FIRST Core Values.

volunteer-of-the-year.name: Volunteer of the Year
volunteer-of-the-year.description: This award celebrates a volunteer who has made a significant impact on FIRST LEGO League this year.

breakthrough.name: Breakthrough
breakthrough.description: This award celebrates a team that made significant progress in their confidence and capability in both the Robot Game and Innovation Project and are a shining example of excellent Core Values. They demonstrate that they understand that what they discover is more important than what they win.

rising-all-star.name: Rising All-Star
rising-all-star.description: This award celebrates a team that the judges notice and expect great things from in the future.

motivate.name: Motivate
motivate.description: This award celebrates a team that embraces the culture of FIRST LEGO League through team building, team spirit, and displayed enthusiasm.

judges-award.name: Judges' Award
judges-award.description: This award celebrates a team that is recognized by the judges for their outstanding work and dedication.

excellence-in-engineering.name: Excellence in Engineering
excellence-in-engineering.description: This award celebrates a team with an efficiently designed robot, an innovative project solution that effectively addresses the season challenge, and Core Values evident in all they do.

advancement.name: Advancement
advancement.description: Teams advancing to the next stage of competition

0.description: (Prematch) The robot and all equipment fi t completely in one launch area and under the height limit:
Soil deposits completely cleared, touching the mat:

1.description: Archaeologist’s brush is not touching the dig site:

0.description: Your team’s minecart is on the opposing team’s field:

1.description: Bonus: And the opposing team’s minecart is on your team’s field:

m03-e1.description: You can only receive the bonus if your team's minecart is on the opposing team’s field.

remarks.0: Your team’s minecart must pass completely through the mineshaft entry to score points for this mission.
remarks.1: It is not possible to earn the bonus if there is no opposing team or in remote competitions.

0.description: Precious artifact is not touching the mine:
Ore blocks not touching the forge:
Millstone is no longer touching its base:
Scale is tipped and touching the mat:
Artifacts are raised above the ground layer:

1.description: Bonus: And the crane flag is at least partly lowered:

m11-e1.description: You can only receive the bonus if the artifacts are raised above the ground layer.

remarks.0: Sand is considered completely cleared when the pull activator is past the line on the mat.

0.description: Mark all artifacts touching the mat and at least partly in the forum:

m14-e1.description: You cannot select "None" when more than one option is selected.

0.description: Sites with a flag at least partly inside and touching the mat:

e1.description: You cannot have the brush in the forum (M14) and touching the excavation site (M01).

e3.description: You cannot have the scale pan in the forum (M14) if it has not been completely removed (M10).

e4.description: You cannot have the ore with fossilized artifact in the forum (M14) if no ore has been removed from the excavation (M06).

e5.description: You cannot have the millstone in the forum (M14) and touching its base (M07).

e6.description: You cannot have the precious artifact in the forum (M14) and touching the mine (M04).

identify.title: IDENTIFY
identify.description: Team had a clearly defined problem that was well researched.

problem.developing: Partially clear definition of the problem

research.developing: Partial evidence of research from one or more sources
research.accomplished: Clear, detailed research from a variety of sources

design.title: DESIGN
design.description: Team worked together while creating a project plan and developing their ideas.

plan.beginning: Minimal evidence of an effective project plan
plan.developing: Partial evidence of an effective project plan
plan.accomplished: Clear evidence of an effective project plan

participation.beginning: Minimal evidence that development process involved all team members
participation.developing: Partial evidence that development process involved all team members
participation.accomplished: Clear evidence that development process involved all team members

create.title: CREATE
create.description: Team developed an original idea or built on an existing one with a prototype model/drawing to represent their solution.

innovation.beginning: Minimal explanation of innovation in solution
innovation.developing: Simple explanation of innovation in solution
innovation.accomplished: Detailed explanation of innovation in solution

model.beginning: Unclear model/drawing that represents the solution
model.developing: Simple model/drawing that represents the solution
model.accomplished: Detailed model/drawing that represents the solution

iterate.title: ITERATE
iterate.description: Team shared their ideas with others, collected feedback, and included improvements to their solution.

share.beginning: Minimal sharing of their solution with others
share.developing: Solution shared with at least one person/group

improve.beginning: Minimal evidence of improvements based on feedback
improve.developing: Partial evidence of improvements based on feedback
improve.accomplished: Clear evidence of improvements based on feedback

communicate.title: COMMUNICATE
communicate.description: Team shared an effective presentation of their solution, its impact on others, and celebrated their team's progress.

explanation.beginning: Unclear explanation of the solution and its potential impact on others
explanation.developing: Partially clear explanation of solution and its potential impact on others
explanation.accomplished: Clear explanation of solution and its potential impact on others

pride.beginning: Presentation shows minimal pride or enthusiasm for their work
pride.developing: Presentation shows partial pride or enthusiasm for their work
pride.accomplished: Presentation clearly shows pride or enthusiasm for their work

identify.title: IDENTIFY
identify.description: Team determined which missions to attempt, explored building and coding resources, and sought guidance as needed.

resources.beginning: Minimal use of building or coding resources
resources.developing: Some use of building or coding resources
resources.accomplished: Clear use of building or coding resources to support their mission strategy

design.title: DESIGN
design.description: Team members worked collaboratively on their designs and developed the building and coding skills needed.

contribution.beginning: Minimal evidence that all team members contributed ideas
contribution.developing: Partial evidence that all team members contributed ideas
contribution.accomplished: Clear evidence that all team members contributed ideas

skills.beginning: Minimal evidence of building and coding skills in all team members
skills.developing: Partial evidence of building and coding skills in all team members
skills.accomplished: Clear evidence of building and coding skills in all team members

create.title: CREATE
create.description: Team developed original designs or improved on existing ones according to their mission strategy.

attachments.beginning: Unclear explanation of attachments and their purpose
attachments.developing: Simple explanation of attachments and their purpose
attachments.accomplished: Clear explanation of innovative attachments and their purpose

code.beginning: Unclear explanation of code and/or sensor use
code.developing: Simple explanation of code and/or sensor use
code.accomplished: Clear explanation of code and/or sensor use

iterate.title: ITERATE
iterate.description: Team repeatedly tested their robot and code to identify areas for improvement and incorporated the findings into their solutions.

test.beginning: Minimal evidence of testing their robot and code
test.developing: Partial evidence of testing their robot and code
test.accomplished: Clear evidence of repeated testing of their robot and code

improve.beginning: Minimal evidence of improvements based on testing
improve.developing: Partial evidence of improvements based on testing
improve.accomplished: Clear evidence of improvements based on testing

communicate.title: COMMUNICATE
communicate.description: Team effectively explained what they learned from the robot design process and celebrated their progress.

explanation.beginning: Unclear explanation of process and lessons learned
explanation.developing: Simple explanation of process and lessons learned
explanation.accomplished: Detailed explanation of process and lessons learned

pride.beginning: Team shows minimal pride or enthusiasm for their work
pride.developing: Team shows partial pride or enthusiasm for their work
pride.accomplished: Team clearly shows pride or enthusiasm for their work

rubrics.core-values-explanation: Criteria on this page with this style of check box count dually toward Innovation Project and Core Values awards rankings. Core Values make up 25% of a team’s Champion’s score and should be demonstrated throughout their work and event experience.
